programme.title: Hawk of the Hills
programme.desc: Led by "The Hawk," a band of Indians terrorizes prospectors in a California valley.

programme.title: Ride, Ryder, Ride!
programme.desc: In their first cinematic outing, Red Ryder and his Indian sidekick help a newspaper publisher clean up her town.

programme.title: With Sitting Bull at the Spirit Lake Massacre
programme.desc: Chief Sitting Bull surveys the settlement at Spirit Lake from afar and vows to retake the land that once belonged to his forefathers.

programme.title: The Two-Gun Man
programme.desc: A cowboy (Ken Maynard) rousts rustlers and woos a blonde (Lucille Powers) on the range.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: A mayor erects a toll-gate on federal land to keep out riff-raff and raise money for the town.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: The agents go to Texas where a large number of Federal Gold Bonds are counterfeit.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: The President Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: The railroad president decides to scrap the Cannonball himself.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: Is There a Doctor in the Roundhouse?
programme.desc: Curtis breaks the throttle of the Cannonball and blocks the way to Kate's jamboree.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A crooked stagecoach driver accuses Cisco and Pancho of stealing $50,000 from him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A prominent investment broker is captured after scheming to have two of his men impersonate Cisco and Pancho at a bank hold-up.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark and Frankie Adams pursue a female outlaw named Belle Starr after her gang steals a herd of horses from the U.S. cavalry.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt teams with Pat Garrett after a large herd of horses is stolen.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Doc resorts to extreme measures to fund his free public clinic.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: The judge learns of a scheme to smuggle guns and ammo to the Indians and finds a way to break it up.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie relies on Tagg's ability as a ventriloquist to save an innocent stage driver from angry townspeople.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Tagg (Jimmy Hawkins) and his friend Billy (Stuffy Singer) run away to a ghost town inhabited by an outlaw gang. With Gail Davis.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: After several people are murdered Hawkeye seeks the help of his friend Benjamin Franklin.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: A young Indian Doctor attempts to practice medicine while the townspeople practice intolerance.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Outlaws plot to steal a trunk containing the savings of a religious group heading for a new life in the West.

programme.title: The Gay Cavalier
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) try to help an unhappy bride.

programme.title: Heart of the Golden West
programme.desc: Roy sidesteps crooked shipping agents by herding Cherokee City's cattle aboard a steamboat bound for market.

programme.title: The Cowboy and the Senorita
programme.desc: Two cowboys ride to the rescue when villains try to cheat a teenage girl out of the gold mine she's due to inherit.

programme.title: The Cowboy and the Prizefighter
programme.desc: Red Ryder (Jim Bannon) KOs a fight racket with sidekick Little Beaver (Little Brown Jug) and a new friend.

programme.title: Daniel Boone, Trail Blazer
programme.desc: The frontiersman (Bruce Bennett) leads settlers to Kentucky, where he makes peace with a Shawnee chief (Lon Chaney).

programme.title: The Lucky Texan
programme.desc: Jerry Mason (John Wayne) and his friend Jake (George Hayes) have to keep two crooks away from their gold.

programme.title: The Courageous Avenger
programme.desc: A law officer tries to bring a traitorous mine foreman to justice.

programme.title: Death Valley
programme.desc: When a young man discovers gold, he must deal with threats.

programme.title: Outpost in Morocco
programme.desc: A French Foreign Legion captain (George Raft) loves an enemy Arab chieftain's daughter (Marie Windsor).

programme.title: Born to Battle
programme.desc: Cattlemen offer a jailed cowboy his freedom if he will agree to help locate a gang of notorious rustlers.
